data.title: Historical Educational visit
data.text: Self-tour done in 35 min.  Lots of artifacts from Mayo brothers & clinic history.  Very architecturally beautiful building inside & out.  Well-worth your time...

data.title: Closed to the public, inside anyway.
data.text:
I had relatives visiting and wanted to show off some of the Rochester history as this is a fine example of historical wealth and privilege. This is a very beautiful mansion high on a hilltop with lovely grounds. I have been here a half dozen times, but the mansion itself has NEVER been open, consequently I know very little about the house or the history.

We walked the grounds (as I have done before) which is on multi-levels. The view is great to Rochester below, albeit quite noisy since the freeway runs close by. The lawns are well maintained but the two ponds are stinky and scummy looking. 

Someday I would love to see the mansion and learn about the history, not sure that is ever going to happen though.

data.title: Gorgeous!
data.text: It is a beautiful place to go visit, even for locals! I love to take my kids there for pictures, or even to just walk the grounds and look at all of the beautiful flowers and brick and stone structures!

data.title: Beautiful grounds
data.text: Great history about Mayo.  Definitely must see if you're interested in learning the history of Mayo Clinic.

data.title: Take a walk
data.text: They have an amazing botanical garden hidden in a lower level of the mansion. There was a wedding setting up Saturday so we didnt stay long but it was beautiful to walk through. Great views and they have tours of the House itself.

data.title: Beautiful House
data.text: Went to an antique sale at the house for a local charity.  Wide variety of items made for a fun shopping experience.  The event was held in the house so had plenty of opportunity to explore inside the house and also walk the grounds.  A lovely place to visit.

data.title: Nice house and peaceful garden.
data.text:
There was a children party there but we could admire the house from outside and enjoy the quietness of the garden which is some steps down the hill.
I recomend spending some time in the garden especially that there are few visitor around....

data.title: Event!
data.text: Attended a wedding in the garden and reception on the patio area.  It was a lovely setting and a beautiful mansion.  Look forward to going there again for a tour.

data.title: A Quiet Respite
data.text: This old mansion was the home of Dr Plummer who worked with the Mayo brothers.  There is beautiful lower garden with ponds and is often used for weddings the house has a lot of the original furniture and I'd fun to explore. Groups can rent the whole house for receptions and dinners.  The ease side of the property is a tree-lined grass area.  Benches are scattered around for quiet sitting.  Parking can be a problem during an event but it is a beautiful location and from the southern highway, you can see the roof and water towers in the hillside. If the house is open there is no charge.

data.title: City Park
data.text: If it a nice day outside I suggest driving up to the Plummer House they have a beautiful garden out there and places for you to sit and read it is open to the public you can walk around and enjoy the lookout the inside is available for groups of people but it must be reserved we have had a few holiday parties at the Plummer House but there is limited amounts of parking for that kind of occasion and everything inside is authentic.

data.title: Learn how one Mayo Doctor lived in a tent to supervise building it!
data.text: Doctor Plummer was a man of many abilities....Designer, Medical Doctor, Architect of homes and buildings, Planner of Medical Equipment for Mayo Clinic, and again, I say...Medical Doctor!

data.title: Go on Wednesday
data.text: We didn't know it but tours are only available on Wednesday. We went on Thursday. The grounds are incredible enough to give 5 stars but we would have LOVED to see the inside of the house.

data.title: Great History surrounding this home
data.text: you can learn about Dr Plummer and family and the history of this home on Rochester Trolley Tour of Historical homes. the fee for the trolley ride and tour is $10.00 per person. if you want a private tour of the home there is a number you can call to arrange a tour  you can also rent the home for parties and receptions

data.title: Work Holiday Gathering
data.text: This was my first visit inside the Plummer House. The grounds, the exterior, even the holiday decorations were STUNNING. But, immediately upon entering the interior, I wanted to find a place where I could volunteer my services to make the place shine and look like it probably did in its grand days. I know that it's probably very difficult to keep a place of this size up, but I was disappointed. The wood paneling was full, the furniture was mismatched and very worn. Maybe i was expecting too much, but ever since visiting, I still have a mental image of what it "could be."  The history is interesting, the architecture amazing, etc. But I'd love for it to represent what it stands for, and I was disappointed. Sorry, Dr. Plummer and family, that we haven't done a better job. It's a beautiful estate with historical relevance that deserves to be beautiful again.

data.title: Couldn't see much
data.text: Based on other reviews we stopped here, looking forward to seeing the house. There wasn't any signage to show people where to go, and at the front door of the house there was a sign saying something like "Closed to the public--guests only." So we wandered around the grounds a little--they were pleasant, but nothing special.

data.title: Hidden in the trees
data.text: We stumbled upon this home and were very amazed at the beauty.  We definitely want to come back and spend more time.

data.title: very interesting
data.text:
We were leisurely driving around the area looking at the houses and saw a sign for a vintage sale at Plummer House.  Followed the signs and went inside to look and bought a few items to help the cause.
Did not get to see the whole  house or have a tour, but liked what we saw.
Wish they would have had someone to give us the story on Dr. Plummer.

data.title: Plummer House, a peaceful, calming experience
data.text: The grounds of this historic home are a joy to walk through or stop a while and just relax.  The lower garden has a waterfall with a small pool at the bottom and an expanse of green lawn surrounded by trees and flowers to immerse yourself in the quiet and calm.  The upper grounds are just as wonderful with large, old trees to provide excellent shade and a place for birds.  A haven of rest and relaxation for all visitors.

data.title: Interesting history about the house and the family that built it.
data.text: I thoroughly enjoyed the tour of the Plummer House, our guide was very informed about the house and family and made the tour fun and interesting.

data.title: Regal home - interesting story
data.text: I found this home to be not only elegant, but regal, the history of this home and the person who built it was intriguing.  He was not only a Dr. but also an architect and drew up as well as built the plans for his home.  It took about 10 years start to finish, but what a gorgeous home! This is just a small part of the history of this home...really worth the visit!
